key_work.title: Chauka, Please Tell Us The Time
key_work.brief_description: An urgent and powerful documentary, secretly filmed on a phone inside the Manus Island detention centre, where asylum seekers trying to reach Australia are indefinitely detained, by Iranian Kurdish journalist Behrouz Boochani, in collaboration with Dutch Iranian filmmaker Arash Kamali Sarvestani.

constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

start.title: Remain
start.brief_description: In her 2018 2-channel video work Remain, Iranian born Melbourne artist Hoda Afshar works with several of the refugees who remain on Manus Island, encouraging the men to ‘re-enact their narratives with their own bodies and [gives] them autonomy to narrate their own stories’.
